717884f.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Sullivan Street
717884f.text:
Broome Street, west from Sullivan Street, showing the bend in
Broome Street at the southern end of Clark Street. The buildings
in the imediate foreground are directly in the path of SLxth
Avenue extension,and are about to be demolished. The west side
of Clark Street will form part of the west side of Sixth Avenue.
The white building at the west corner of Clark Street is Public
School No. 38.
1926.
M.Y BE REPRODUCED.
717884f.folder: Broome Street & Sullivan Street, Manhattan, NY

709257f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - w.s. - South - Broome Street
709257f-a.text:
Sixth Ave. (Extension), west side, south from, but not including Broone,
to and including Watts Streets, showing (at the extreme right), a po:tion of
the Underwriters Salvage Co. d-story building, at the S.W. corner of Broome
Street. The 3-story house, in the center of the view, is a frame building,
and bears the No. 46 Watts Street, and is at the N.W. corner.
June 7, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
709257f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & w.s. & South & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

723463f-a.title: Manhattan: Sullivan Street - Broome Street
723463f-a.text:
(1)
Sullivan Street, east side, from Broome to Spring Streets, seen from
Sixth Avenue at Spring Street. South of Broome Street, Sullivan
Street has been absorbed by Sixth Avenue.
Nos. 57, 59 Sullivan Street, adjoining the vacant N.E. corner of
Broome Street, are frame houses, faced with brick, and so are
85, 87 Sullivan Street, the two little houses adjoining the five-
story tenement house at the S.E. corner of Spring Street. No. 87
has an attic with dormer windows.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 303.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of both sides of Sullivan Street, northward.
January 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723463f-a.folder: Sullivan Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

717885f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Sullivan Street
717885f-a.text:
(1)
Broome, to Sullivan, to Clark Streets. (Before Reconstruction).
March 22, 1920.
(2)
Tame. (After Reconstruction).
President Boro gh of Manhatten.
CREDIT LINE IVPERATIVE.  September 18. 1921.

709258f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Broome Street
709258f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue (left), east side, and Sullivan Street (right), east side,
north from Broome Street. The two houses at the N.E. corner of
Sullivan and Broome Streets have been demolished, leaving exposed
the frame side of 59 Sullivan Street adjoining the vacant corner.
March 1W, 1932.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
709258f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

709260f-b.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Sullivan Street - Broome Street.
709260f-b.text:
(1) and (2)
Sixth Avenue and Sullivan Street, north
from Broome Strect. The former is thru the center
and the Butterick Building fronts on same at Spring
Street. This structure bears No. 161 Sixth Avenue.
Buildings at the left are included with this thorough-
fare tho previously they faced on the now obliterated
Clark Street. To the right appears an extensive view
up Sullivan Street. The C.G. Hussey \&: Co.occupy the
two-story building, No. 140-8 Sixth Avenue.
PST2S E2N71T 7NAo ..2  v 2e. )939
P. L. Sperr
V 710  NO REPRODUCTIONS FE0N45 1
(3)
A similar view to No. 2. The cleared land
in the foreground is a triangular plot separating the
Avenue from Sullivan Street.
O 70 N  E7N2r e18:  View 3: June 27, 1932 T  N-
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

723461f-b.title: Manhattan: Sullivan Street - Broome Street
723461f-b.text:
(1)
5S, 57, 59, dl, 63-e7 Sullivan Street, at and adioining the N.E.
corner of Broome Street, seen from Sixth Avenue Extension, the
former west side of Sullivan Street, during the early stages of
subway construction. Nos. 57 and 59 Sullivan Street, adjoining
the corner, are frame houses faced with brick.
October 19, 1W8.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, with clearing at 55 Sullivan Street, the identical
scene three and a half years later, showing the N.E. conner of
Sixth Avenue in the left foreground. The new subway is completed,
but will not be opened till September 10 of the year of this
view. The corner building at Sullivan and Broome Streets has
been demolished, exposing the frame south side of No. S7
Sullivan Street.
March 1W, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723461f-b.folder: Sullivan Street & Broome Street, Manhattan, NY

1926.
